citations.narrative:
The records that the applicant provided for inspection were missing 15 dogs, and did not contain all the information as
required on the APHIS form 7005. Complete and accurate records must be kept in order to ensure that each animal's
identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate tracking/tracing of animals. The applicant must use a USDA form
7005 (Dogs on Hand).

In the middle kennel building, there was a wire divider between two enclosures on the west side that was rusted and
broken. The broken wires can be a sharp point that can cause harm, or allow the dogs to go between enclosures. The
applicant must repair or replace this divider and ensure all enclosures are safe and structurally sound.

The program of veterinary care was missing the frequency of the kennel visit and exam of each dog. It is important to
have the attending veterinarian visit the kennel and exam the dogs to ensure dogs are meeting the veterinary
requirements. The applicant must develop and document a veterinary approved program of veterinary care that includes
kennel visits , not less than every 12 months and exams for each kennel dog.
The program of veterinary care was missing the preventative care section. The applicant did not have the preventative
care and treatment plan to ensure healthy and unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes,
ears, skin, and teeth, which are important to the dogs health. The applicant must develop and document a plan as part of
the program of veterinary care.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by September 23, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The records that the applicant provided for inspection were missing 15 dogs, and did not contain all the information as 
required on the APHIS form 7005. Complete and accurate records must be kept in order to ensure that each animal's 
identity can be known with certainty and to facilitate tracking/tracing of animals. The applicant must use a USDA form 
7005 (Dogs on Hand). 
3.6(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
In the middle kennel building, there was a wire divider between two enclosures on the west side that was rusted and 
broken. The broken wires can be a sharp point that can cause harm, or allow the dogs to go between enclosures. The 
applicant must repair or replace this divider and ensure all enclosures are safe and structurally sound. 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The program of veterinary care was missing the frequency of the kennel visit and exam of each dog. It is important to 
have the attending veterinarian visit the kennel and exam the dogs to ensure dogs are meeting the veterinary 
requirements. The applicant must develop and document a veterinary approved program of veterinary care that includes 
kennel visits , not less than every 12 months and exams for each kennel dog. 
The program of veterinary care was missing the preventative care section. The applicant did not have the preventative 
care and treatment plan to ensure healthy and unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and healthy eyes, 
ears, skin, and teeth, which are important to the dogs health. The applicant must develop and document a plan as part of 
the program of veterinary care. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class A license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by September 23, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection.

Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
